results.title: The Odd couple
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Howard W. Koch and Gene Saks
results.brief_description: Based on the Neil Simon play, Walter Matthau and Jack Lemmon star in this offbeat comedy about two divorced men who try to share an apartment in New York without killing each other. Lemmon plays the irritating Felix Unger, obsessive and fussy, who proves that cleanliness is not a virtue, but a mental illness! Matthau, plays the slob Oscar Madison, who wreaks havoc on a room with the speed and thoroughness of a tornado. The performances are excellent, and the precision timing of the two actors infuses the film with a sense of spontaneity.

results.title: The Odd Angry Shot
results.creator_credit: Samson Productions, Sue Milliken and Tom Jeffrey
results.brief_description: John Jarratt plays a young man who enlists to serve in Vietnam. The film follows him as he serves active duty in one of the toughest of army units - the Australian Special Air Service. In between the savagery of combat the men of the unit gamble, play tricks on each other and drink a numbing amount of alcohol. This hard-edged comedy is a celebration of the Australian male ethos of larrikinism. Amid both the horror and tedium of war, it is only the mens’ sense of humour that saves them from descending into madness. One of the few Australian features to deal directly with Australian combat in Vietnam, “The Odd Angry Shot” features an excellent cast including John Hargreaves, Bryan Brown, Graeme Blundell and Graham Kennedy. Based on the novel by William Nagle.

results.title: The Nutty professor
results.creator_credit: Paramount Pictures, Ernest D Glucksman and Jerry Lewis
results.brief_description: Professor Julius F. Kelp (Jerry Lewis), is a chemistry teacher in a large university. Tired of being pushed around and humiliated, he dedicates himself to finding a scientific solution to his problem and discovers a chemical formula that transforms him from a clumsy, shy weakling into an irresistable, dynamic individual, called Buddy Love. However the potion often wears off at inappropriate times with embarrassing and hilarious results. Julius finds himself juggling a hectic doublelife, meek chemistry professor by day, local celebrity and heart throb by night. Inevitably these two worlds collide. Written and directed by Jerry Lewis, this madcap comedy is a swinging combination of farce, slapstick and romance.

results.title: The Nun's story
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, Henry Blanke and Fred Zimmerman
results.brief_description: This story begins in 1930 with Sister Luke’s (Audrey Hepburn) journey from postulant to nun. Of her solemn vows of poverty, chastity, silence and obedience, Sister Luke knows the last will be the most difficult to achieve. Her strong will and intellectual pride, qualities destined to make her a brilliant nurse, threaten to undermine her holy calling. Unable to be obedient to her heart, Sister Luke comes perilously close to breaking. Highlighted by Audrey Hepburn’s performance, this film received eight Academy Award Nominations and also stars, Peter Finch, Dame Edith Evans, Dame Peggy Ashcroft, Dean Jagger and Mildred Dunnock.

results.title: The Nugget
results.creator_credit: Film Finance Corporation Australia, Macquarie Film Corporation, b j films, Bill Bennett and Jennifer Cluff
results.brief_description: Lotto, Wookie and Sue are three working class mates whose favourite pastime is to frolic in the outback on a futile hunt for gold, dodging the protestations of their spouses. One day however luck befalls the hapless trio when they happen upon a giant nugget of gold, making them instantly rich. Avarice soon takes over and former rock-solid friendships are torn asunder by rivalries and petty disagreements. Bill Bennett (Kiss or Kill, Spider and Rose) borrows from the set-up of John Huston’s “The Treasure of the Sierra Madre” (1948) but inverts the drama in favour of slapstick comedy, trading on Aussie movie cliches (redneck attitudes, colloquial banter, ockerism, boozing, mateship) familiar themes from such comedies as “The Castle”, “Welcome to Woop, Woop”, “Muriel’s wedding” and even “They’re a weird mob” to create an allegorical fable about the perils of wealth cast in a fun, lightweight, albeit highly predictable, manner.

results.title: The Ninth gate
results.brief_description: Legendary director Roman Polanski subtly intertwines his trademark themes of gothic, supernatural excess with hints of suspense and humour to deliver a provocative and atmospheric screen adaptation of Arturo Perez Reverte’s 1993 best-selling novel, “El Club Dumas”. Unscrupulous rare book broker Dean Corso gets more than he has bargained for after he is hired by multimillionaire Boris Balkan to authenticate a volume of The Nine Gates of the Kingdom of Shadows, a priceless seventeenth century occult text whose woodcut images, when assembled correctly, are rumoured to have the power to summon the Devil. Dispatched to Europe to hunt down the only two other copies known to exist, Corso soon finds himself enmeshed in a mystery of epic proportions as he follows a trail of clues, encounters eccentric bibliophiles, is relentlessly pursued by a widening circle of deadly foes and is rescued by an enigmatic and ubiquitous green-eyed beauty. As the people he has been dealing with in relation to the book begin to die under bizarre circumstances, Corso must locate the missing images, both to save his own skin and to resolve his own growing obsession with the arcane legend of the book. Stars Johnny Depp as Corso, Frank Langella as Boris Balkan, Lena Olin as Liana Telfer, and Emmanuelle Seigner as The Girl.

results.title: The Nightmare before Christmas
results.creator_credit: Touchstone Pictures, Denise Di Novi, Tim Burton and Henry Selick
results.brief_description: This delightfully different animated fantasy opens the door to an intriguing new world - where extraordinary surprises and captivating music await. Journey on an incredible adventure of fantastic sights and sounds with the whimsical characters, Pumpkin Jack, Jack Skellington, and the rag doll, Sally. One day Jack discovers Christmastown - a glittering glory of bright lights and shiny packages. Charmed by its magic, Jack brings back this newfound holiday to his ghoulish friends, triggering an hilarious turn of events. Told through the innovative technique of stop-motion animation is an unparalleled adventure that dazzles the eye and charms the mind. Cast includes Danny Elfman, Chris Sarandon, Catherine O’Hara, William Hickey, Glenn Shadix.

results.title: The Night the Prowler
results.creator_credit: Chariot Films, New South Wales Film Corporation, Anthony Buckley and Jim Sharman
results.brief_description: This story begins as a comedy surrounding the reactions of the Bannisters to an alleged attack on their daughter, Felicity. From this point on, Felicity embarks on an odyssey of self-discovery. Adapted by Nobel prize-winning author, Patrick White, from his own short story. Stars John Derum, Maggie Kirkpatrick and Terry Camilleri.

results.title: The Night porter
results.creator_credit: Ital Noleggio Cinematografico, Lotar Films, Robert Gordon Edwards and Liliana Cavani
results.brief_description: It is a dozen years after World War II and a group of ex-Nazis and Gestapo meet regularly in an exclusive hotel in Vienna. The porter at the hotel (Dirk Bogarde) is an ex-SS concentration camp officer who one day recognises one of the hotel’s guests as a former prisoner (Charlotte Rampling) whom he raped when she was fourteen and then proceeded to use as his sex-slave till the end of the war. In meeting again they continue their sado-masochistic relationship which inevitably, and horrifically, leads to tragedy. This controversial film has been praised as profound, denounced as morally corrupt and ridiculed as high camp. It continues to divide audiences.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ital Noleggio Cinematografico, Lotar Films, Robert Gordon Edwards and Liliana Cavani

results.title: The Night of the hunter [DVD]
results.creator_credit: United Artists Corporation, Paul Gregory, Charles Laughton and James Agee
results.brief_description: On its initial release “The Night of the Hunter” shocked audiences and critics with its combination of lyrical imagery and sadistic violence. However, this masterpiece of horror, directed by actor Charles Laughton and based on a script by author and critic, James Agee, remains one of the most astonishingly beautiful and disturbing films ever made. Two young children are thrown into a nightmarish world when their mother (Shelley Winters), remarries a psychopathic preacher (Robert Mitchum), murder forces them to flee and seek refuge with an old woman (the magnificent Lillian Gish). As the preacher pursues them through the rural splendour of the South, the suspense and terror intensifies to an almost surreal pitch. Also stars James Gleason, Evelyn Varden and Peter Graves. Cinematography is by the master of light, Stanley Cortez. Mitchum’s frightening central performance is possibly the finest work of his career. Based on the novel by Davis Grubb. Music by Walter Schumann.
